name: Fractured Desserts Online Quiz | Fractured Food | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Creme brulee & Cream brulee.

	Yum, this is my favorite dessert!

tapioca.

	Sometimes a nice bland dessert like tapioca just hits the spot. Kids love it and it's easy to make.

tiramisu.

	This delectable dessert is made with spongecake and Mascarpone cream with Grand Marnier!

Crepes Suzette & Crepe Suzette.

	Thin tender pancakes are folded and drenched with a buttery orange sauce with brandy (I think). Often, this dessert is served flambee. Flaming it was banned at a restaurant where I worked because there was a terrible accident once. The waiter dropped the brandy bottle and the whole shebang went up in flames. No one was badly hurt, luckily.

baked Alaska.

	This is an ice-cream cake covered with a meringue igloo and baked. By the way, I got the name Olenska from Edith Wharton's 'The Age of Innocence'--Madame Ellen Olenska is the heroine.

banana cream pie.

	My nephew Pablo has ordered this at least 100 times at Walker's Pie Shop in Albany, California.

strawberry shortcake & strawberry short cake.

	My dear departed Grandma Ola Ferguson Raymer made the most wonderful strawberry shortcake using Bisquick and fresh strawberries that she grew in her own strawberry patch. By the way, Burpee's is a seed company.

English trifle.

	Yum, it has layers of spongecake, custard, and fruit. Sometimes it has liquor in it, I think.

lemon meringue pie.

	Have you ever done the merengue while eating lemon meringue pie? I didn't think so.

German chocolate cake.

	This rich and yummy buttermilk chocolate cake (which isn't really German) has layers of buttery coconut pecan filling. I wish I had a giant wedge of it right now! I'd eat it with a steaming cup of French-roast coffee.
